content.description: The route can wander.  Your reach may determine whether you choose the left or right of the arete (or a combination of both).  The top is where you'll make to make the toughest decision.
content.location: This route is the arete on the right of the chimney/dihedral.

content.description: This route has been closed by order of the Park Superintendent. The anchors were removed.
content.location: Closed Route. Located on the far right side of the Little Amphitheater area 10 feet right of Pee Break.

content.description: The route starts with some big ledges and thins to some smaller ledges before a small roof. Pull the roof (5.8 ish) or go right to a large chimney (stays on grade at ~5.6). Go up the chimney or up the face...the face is a tad harder than the chimney.
content.protection: top-rope -- can also be led on gear,  ending at the bolted anchor.
content.location: The route is on the right end of the Little Amphitheater. Look for a left-facing dihedral to start.

content.description:
Climb over a few blocks and choose either right or left to get past the roof (straight up the roof is 5.8)

The route is somewhat vegetated as it doesn't get climbed often. Still worth a climb if you are in the area.
content.protection: Bolted chains at the top ledge. Easily found to (skier's) right from the anchors for Pee Break.
content.location: Left of Pee Break, Right of Erocktica. Belay and Start are from a small vegetated ledge.

content.description: This can be done while someone is on KMA. Start at beginning of overhang, straight up, to traverse left along ledge with tiny tree. Get both feet set, because there are only the few thin holds you need to reach the arete edge. The rest is 5.6 and sloped. Harder variation does not traverse left, finishing up on KMA ledge.
content.protection: TR only for this route.  Bolts/chains are on the face.
content.location: This route is in the Little Amphitheater.Descend the Three Bears gully and take a left on the bottom trail.

content.description: Climb the face to the left of the left facing dihedral.
content.protection: Bolted anchors, hiding around the tree and down a bit towards the edge if approaching from grindstone trail
content.location: Just left of the route "Dirty Rotten Scoundrel".

content.description: This is a new line of glue-in bolts to a new set of anchors. Generally follow the line, but at the third bolt move a little left, then up and back right.  Maybe the best 5.10 face route at Pilot.
content.location: This is the face in between Dirty Rotten Scoundrel and KMA, on the left side of the Little Amphitheater.

content.description: This is a fun route.  Start in the big crack to a ledge, then use some small but good holds to another big crack, then on to the anchors.
content.location: This route follows the crack system just to the right of Place Your Bet.

content.description: Use "Improve this page" if you know!
content.location: Left of Erocktica under the crack in the roof.

content.description: Start under the roof and follow the bolt line.  Crux is getting past the 4th bolt.  Low angle slab leads to the 5th bolt and then route steepens again to the anchors.
content.location: Located on the wall to the right of Grandpa's belay and left of Pee Break.  Look for the bolt line and small roofs.

content.description: Climb left-facing dihedral through short chimney to ledge, continue to anchors.
content.location: Route starts in the dihedral left of Place Your Bet

content.description:
The route follows the flared chimney to its end, then out over small roof continuing to a small ledge. Continue directly up on juggy holds to top out.

This route appears to be seldom climbed and has some vegetation / briars in the lower part of the chimney. Since the chimney flares out, it requires some unique chimney techniques. Either face of the chimney can also be climbed, with right face probably adding to the grade. The top of the route can also done over a bulge on thinner holds for a much higher grade crux. This bulge is easily avoided by moving slightly left and thereby keeps a different line from Buzzard's Breath while maintaining the 5.7 grade.
content.protection: Rim anchors. There are three rim anchors above Buzzard's Breath, suggest using two bolts to climber's left. Watch for small swing to right if one falls on this route.
content.location:
About 10' left of Buzzard's Breath at the base of a flared chimney. Base of the route is right along the hiking trail, so be thoughtful on start and belaying.

Belayer must NOT stand in the trail to belay!

There is space for the belayer on the opposite side of trail from the route. This is a high usage area for BOTH climbers, hikers and runners, please keep the trail clear for anyone using the trail.

content.description: Base is very ledged, lower part uses edge of slanting crack, normal route moves left toward and then along the arete. Upper part is juggy, 5.7 finish is around left. Straight up center line is harder, that finish can be an overhang to the right. Center finish is very hard overhang pull on left flake.
content.protection: Three new top bolts allow two ropes, including left-side dihedral jam route. Do not rig as three-point. Some rope-rub at upper ledge, or very long runners.
content.location: The narrow Lower Trail between 'Pee Break' and the Amphitheater passes this wall. Take upper footpath toward 'Pee Break' anchors, but make a left. Three Bears Gully nearby downhill.
